desc: CD276 encodes a member of the B7 immunoglobulin superfamily and is thought to function in the regulation of T-cell mediated immune response.

CD276 encodes an immune checkpoint molecule and member of the B7 immunoglobulin superfamily of proteins; it is also known as B7-H3. B7-H3 is a transmembrane protein found in various cell types, including fibroblasts, endothelial cells and osteoclast. Additionally, B7-H3 is expressed in immune cells, particularly antigen presenting cells. It is expected to play a role in T-cell mediated immmune response (PMID: 27208063, 22437870). B7-H3 is overexpressed in a variety of human cancers and has been associated with disease spread and poor prognosis (PMID: 24892449, 22473715, 16489649, 18042703).
